New_Brunswick.Fellowship Farm Cooperative Association:
The Fellowship Farm Cooperative Association was a Utopian anarchist community in the Stelton section of Piscataway Township, New Jersey that was started in 1912.


== History ==
The farm was inaugurated on Thanksgiving Day in 1912. 263 acres (1.06 km2) of active farmland was purchased by Ernest H. Liebel from J. C. Letson in Stelton and each member was leased 1-acre (4,000 m2) of land.
